column4: I have lucid running on a desktop and a netbook. I am trying to setup ssh so I can access my desktop from my netbook. i am following https://help.ubuntu.com/9.04/serverguide/C/openssh-server.html . when i attempt to do ssh-copy-id i get an error message that the connection was refused on port 22. what am i missing?
Have you started the ssh server? How about ps -ef | grep sshd
on the netbook or on the desktop?
On the machine you want to connect to
scratch that it is not running on the netbook
but i would think that's not the problem
Have you tried connecting with a 'normal' ssh command?
my netbook can ssh to my desktop like that, yeah. and vice versa
Then your ssh servers are working perfectly fine. I'll quickly check the tutorial you are following, hold on a sec
i think that did it actually
You don't want to use keys? Since that's what the ssh-copy-id command is for.
yeah, but now that i did that, the ssh-copy-id command worked...
i guess you have to log in once the old-fashioned mortal way?
good thing they made a note of that in the howto...

I guess the problem was that there existed no .ssh directory on the target machine. Once you connect to another box, the host key is saved in .ssh/known_hosts, so the directory is created automatically, enabling ssh-copy-id to work.
I'm glad I could help you anyway.
